running.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the activity or sport of running
running.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Did you go running this morning?
New facilities include a pool and a running track.
running.translation[3].definitions[0].de: the way in which an organization or system is managed or organized
running.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: He has little say in the running of the company.
running.translation[3].definitions[1].de: to have some hope or no hope of winning something
running.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: Two European aircraft builders are in the running for the contract.
be in the running/out of the running for
running.translation[4].definitions[0].de: an argument etc that continues or is repeated over a long period of time
running.translation[4].definitions[0].ex: the running debate over taxes and growth
running.translation[4].definitions[1].de: a total that is continually increased as new costs, amounts etc are added
running.translation[4].definitions[1].ex: We have been keeping a running total of layoff announcements by major corporations.
running.translation[4].definitions[2].de: a machine that is in running order is working correctly
running.translation[4].definitions[2].ex: They had failed to keep the crane in running order.
running.translation[4].definitions[3].de: the order in which the different parts of an event have been arranged to take place
running.translation[4].definitions[3].ex: The running order had to be changed at the last minute.
running.translation[4].definitions[4].de: small repairs that you do to a machine to keep it working
